Description: The queried IPv4 or IPv6 address.
Notes: IPv6 may be compressed (shortened) in display.

Description: Whether the address is IPv4 or IPv6.
Service provider associated with the IP allocation.
Notes: Often shows carrier or upstream provider.

Description: Entity that owns/uses the IP range.
Notes: May differ from the ISP brand name.

Description: Autonomous System Number announcing the IP via BGP.
Notes: Usually the most reliable ownership/routing field.
Country-level is typically the most accurate location field.
Can lag behind reassignment or routing changes.

Description: Estimated city associated with the IP.
Notes: Often wrong; do not treat as precise.
Not GPS—often points to ISP hubs or city centers.

Description: Timezone inferred from the location fields.
Reverse DNS name mapped to the IP.
Notes: Often empty; depends on provider configuration.

Description: Whether traffic appears to come from a proxy/VPN.
Whether the IP appears in public blocklists.
Notes: Results depend on which lists are checked.

Description: Likely abuse type: spam, proxy, malware, etc.
Notes: Best used as a hint, not proof.
